avalancheActivity.comment: Avalanches can be triggered in the weak layers by one sole skier in some places, and grow to medium size. Danger zones occur mostlyn on W/N/E facing slopes in transitions from shallow to deeper snow, e.g. at entry points into gullies and bowls, a on very steep shady slopes above 2200m.  Attention must be given to the dangers of being swept along and forced to take a fall.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Caution: weak layers in old snowpack can trigger in isolated cases

snowpackStructure.comment: W/N/E facing slopes above 2200m: in the lowermost part of the snowpack are faceted expansively metamorphosed weak layers evident. The uppermost part of the snowpack is expansively metamorphosed, there is surface hoar and also faceted crystals. Sunny slopes below 2800m: the snowpack is largely stable, with a crust on the surface. Over small areas it is highly diverse. Below 1700m there is hardly any snow on the ground.

tendency.highlights: Weak layers in the old snowpack demand caution

weatherForecast.comment: On Wednesday, generally gray skies, cloud and fog, some light snow snowers in the mountains, only minor amounts expected. Sunshine will be rare. Light to moderate southerly winds (30 km/hr). At 1000m: 0 degrees; at 2000m: -3 degrees; at 3000m: -8 degrees. Source: GeoSphere Austria

avalancheActivity.comment: Weak layers can trigger in transitions into gullies and bowls in very isolated cases, releases small, particularly on NW/N/NE facing slopes above 2000m, generally triggerable only by large additional loading. Attention must be given to the dangers of being swept along and forced to take a fall.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Avalanches hardly possible, danger zones occur seldom.

snowpackStructure.comment: Along the Italian border some snowfall is anticipated. Shady slopes: there are faceted expansively metamorphosed weak layers evident in the old snowpack. The snowpack is largely stable, with a surface crust. There is little snow on the ground. Below 1700 m there is hardly any snow.

tendency.highlights: No significant change i avalanche danger levels expected

weatherForecast.comment: On Wednesday, generally gray skies, cloud and fog, some light snow snowers in the mountains, only minor amounts expected. Sunshine will be rare. Light to moderate southerly winds (30 km/hr). At 1000m: 0 degrees; at 2000m: -3 degrees; at 3000m: -8 degrees. Source: GeoSphere Austria
